data.approach: Add a lazygit-style CTA section below the All Set screen after setup completes. Include: 1) Link to jat.tools/docs, 2) Invite to contribute on GitHub, 3) Donate button (GitHub Sponsors). Will add a new section to the setup completion screen in +page.svelte.

data.question: Need GitHub repo URL and sponsorship details for the CTA links

data.approach: Adding lazygit-style CTA section to setup completion screen with docs, contribute, star, and sponsor links. GitHub repo: github.com/joewinke/jat

summary: Added lazygit-style community CTA section to setup completion screen
Links to jat.tools/docs, github.com/joewinke/jat (contribute + star), and GitHub Sponsors
CTA appears after All Set card, styled to match existing dark oklch theme
No new dependencies or components - pure template addition
reviewFocus: Check visual appearance matches lazygit style

data.approach: Updating CTA copy - acknowledge users as developers by virtue of using an ADE, not just git

summary: Updated CTA copy - removed git reference, simply acknowledges user as a developer
Identified opportunity to add community engagement CTA for new users after setup
Proposed adding donation button and contribution links for open source users
Considered documentation discovery mechanisms for first-time users

suggestedTasks.title: Implement Community Contribution CTA in Setup Completion Screen
suggestedTasks.description: Design and integrate a user-friendly call-to-action section in the post-setup screen. Include links to project documentation, GitHub repository, and ways to contribute or donate. Ensure the UI is welcoming and informative for developers discovering the tool.
suggestedTasks.reason: Enhance user engagement and open source community involvement

suggestedTasks.title: Research Standard OSS Donation Mechanisms
suggestedTasks.description: Investigate common donation platforms and integration strategies for open source projects. Compare GitHub Sponsors, Open Collective, Patreon, and direct donation methods. Recommend the most developer-friendly and low-friction approach for the project.
suggestedTasks.reason: Support sustainable development through community funding

data.approach: Add favicon and Open Graph meta tags to /setup page (and IDE if missing)

summary: Copied marketing site assets to IDE: favicon.png, apple-touch-icon.png, icon-192.png, icon-512.png, og-image.png, manifest.json
Updated app.html with favicon, OG meta tags, Twitter card tags, description, and theme-color
Added setup-specific OG title/description overrides to /setup page svelte:head
All assets match marketing site at jat.tools
